pageTitle: I like stuff | Let me write
textBeforeTable: The breakfast (feminine) Nouns Summary Colazione: Breakfast (feminine, might also be a plural) Meals Bottiglia: bottle (feminine): sure, not crockery in the traditional sense, but where else would you put it? Ciotola: bowl (feminine) Crockery Birra: beer (feminine): very important! In fact a large chunk of this lesson seems to be knowing who drinks beer. Lei beve birra, Gli uomini bevono birra, Bevo birra…. Drinks Torta: cake (feminine). Another work we see in English, but normally with the French spelling torte Burro: butter (masculine) Manzo: beef (masculine) Food More food, more meals and definitely more beer and bottles to drink it from. This food unit is really quite long, but not many words in each lesson. The main purpose of these lessons I think is to really get use to the sentence construction. 15 Jan Duolingo Itallian: Food 1.3 About I like stuff
textAfterTable: Le bottiglie Plural The biscuits The butter (masculine) Article noun plural English Il burro Singular The butter I burri Plural The butters The beer (feminine) Article noun plural English La birra Singular The beer Le birre Plural The beers The cake (feminine) Article noun plural English La torta Singular The cake Le torte Plural The cakes The beef (masculine) Article noun plural English Il manzo Singular The beef I manzi Plural The beefs Comments Leave a Comment Categories Duolingo, Italian Duolingo Italian: Food 1.2 15 Jan Food 2 is simply some more common foods and learning what the word for food is (cibo). For some reason some obviously phallic foods are denoted as feminine. Food Banana: Banana, simply enough (but oddly feminine) Carota: Carrot (srtangely
